snippet: Should he seek political asylum, Ling Wancheng, the brother of a former top Chinese government official, could be one of the most damaging defectors in China’s history.
abstract: Relations between United States and China have been strained over demands by Chinese government that US extradite Ling Wancheng, businessman who fled to US and could be one of most important defectors in Chinese history should he seek political asylum; Ling is younger brother of Ling Jihua, former director of Communist Party's General Office and one of most prominent casualties of Pres Xi Jingping's anticorruption campaign.

byline.original: By MICHAEL FORSYTHE and MARK MAZZETTI
byline.contributor: Michael Forsythe reported from Loomis, and Mark Mazzetti from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Should he seek political asylum, Ling Wancheng, the brother of a former top Chinese government official, could be one of the most damaging defectors in China’s history.

headline.main: China Seeks Businessman Said to Have Fled to U.S., Further Straining Ties
headline.print_headline: China Seeks Businessman Said to Have Fled to U.S.
